revision.text:
{{pp|small=yes}} {{Infobox comedian | name = Maz Jobrani | image = 051207-MPLS-011MazJobrani.jpg | image_size = 220 | caption = Jobrani in May 2007 | pseudonym = | birth_name = Maziyar Jobrani | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1972|2|26|mf=y}} | birth_place = [[Tehran]], [[Pahlavi dynasty|Iran]] | death_date = | death_place = | medium = [[Stand up comedy|Stand-up]], [[Television]], [[Film]] | nationality = Iranian-American | active = 1990s–present | genre = [[Observational comedy]], [[Satire]] | subject = [[Racism]]/[[Race relations]], [[Islamophobia]], [[Iranian culture]],
[[Islam in the United States]],
[[Middle East]] | influences = | influenced = | spouse = | domesticpartner = | notable_work = | signature = | website = {{URL| mazjobrani.com}} | footnotes = | module = }} '''Maziyar''' "'''Maz'''" '''Jobrani''' ({{lang-fa|مازیار جبرانی}}; born February 26, 1972) is an [[Iranian-American]] comedian and actor who is part of the "[[Axis of Evil Comedy Tour|Axis of Evil]]" comedy group. The group appeared on a comedy special on [[Comedy Central]]. Jobrani has also appeared in numerous films, television shows, including ''[[Better Off Ted]]'', on radio, and in comedy clubs. His filmography includes roles in ''[[The Interpreter]]'', ''[[Friday After Next]]'', ''[[Dragonfly (2002 film)|Dragonfly]]'', and ''[[Jimmy Vestvood: Amerikan Hero]]''. He appears as a regular character on the 2017 CBS sitcom ''[[Superior Donuts (TV series)|Superior Donuts]]''. He is also currently a board member of the [[National Iranian American Council]] (NIAC).{{Cite web| url= https://www.niacouncil.org/about-niac/staff-board/ |title= Staff and Board | website= NIAC| access-date=2018-04-05}} ==Early life and education== Jobrani was born in [[Tehran]], [[Iran]].{{cite news |url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/blogs/persianality/detail?blogid=36&entry_id=20080 |title=Talking with Maz Jobrani |accessdate=January 22, 2009 |date=September 8, 2007 |last=Rezaian |first=Jason |work=The San Francisco Chronicle}} He and his parents moved to [[California]] when he was six years old.Maz Jobrani Comedy Central Special He was raised in [[Tiburon, California|Tiburon]] in the [[San Francisco Bay]] area. He attended [[Redwood High School (Larkspur, California)|Redwood High School]] in [[Larkspur, California|Larkspur]], and was inducted into the Redwood distinguished alumni class of 2017.{{cite web|last1=Schten|first1=Rachel|title=Avenue of Giants inductees hail from diverse fields|url=http://redwoodbark.org/2017/03/avenue-giants-inductees-hail-diverse-fields/|website=Redwood Bark|accessdate=16 March 2017|date=15 March 2017}} Jobrani studied [[political science]] and Italian at [[UC Berkeley]], where he received a B.A. degree. He was enrolled in a [[Ph.D.]] program at [[UCLA]] when he decided to pursue his childhood dream of acting and performing comedy.{{cite web |url=http://www.mazjobrani.com |title=ABC's The Knights of Prosperity bio |first=Gourishankar |last=Subramaniam |work=[[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]] |year=2007 |accessdate=November 7, 2007}} [[File:Maz Jobrani - Persian American Comedian in Amsterdam Meervaart Theater 2014.JPG|thumb|260px|right|Maz Jobrani in a show in Amsterdam, May 2014]] ==Career== ===Television and radio=== Jobrani has since made appearances on shows like ''[[The Colbert Report]]'', ''[[The Tonight Show with Jay Leno]]'', ''[[The Late Late Show with Craig Ferguson]]'', ''[[Talkshow with Spike Feresten]]'', ''[[Whitney (TV series)|Whitney]]'', and regularly performs at top comedy clubs (in California and New York) such as [[The Comedy Store]]. He made an appearance as a dental patient on an episode of ''[[Still Standing (TV series)|Still Standing]]'', in the [[pilot episode]]s of ''[[Better Off Ted]]'', ''[[The Knights of Prosperity]]'', on an episode of ''[[Cedric the Entertainer Presents]]'', on an episode of ''[[Malcolm in the Middle]]'' as Robber #2 and on an episode of ''[[The West Wing]]'' as a Saudi prince. He also made an appearance in ''[[13 Going on 30]]''. He has toured with the [[Axis of Evil Comedy Tour]]. He provided the voice of Ahmed Farahnakian in the audiobook version of ''[[World War Z]]''. Jobrani has written a movie with a friend called ''[[Jimmy Vestvood: Amerikan Hero]]''.{{cite web |url=http://www.sandiego.com/comedy/interview-with-comedian-maz-jobrani |title=Interview With Comedian Maz Jobrani |first=Gordon |last=Downs |work=SanDiego.com |year=2011 |accessdate=February 14, 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110216203627/http://www.sandiego.com/comedy/interview-with-comedian-maz-jobrani |archivedate=February 16, 2011 |df= }} Jobrani makes occasional appearances on [[NPR]]'s news quiz show ''[[Wait Wait... Don't Tell Me!]]'' and [[American Public Media]]'s ''[[Wits (radio program)|Wits]]''. He appeared on episode 118, October 28, 2010 of ''[[WTF with Marc Maron]]''. Additionally, Jobrani co-hosts his own podcast on the [[All Things Comedy]] podcasting network with fellow comedians [[Al Madrigal]] and [[Chris Spencer (actor)|Chris Spencer]]. Titled ''[[Minivan Men]]'', the podcast chronicles the lives and experiences of the three hosts with particular focus on fatherhood. He played Jafar in the 2015 musical fantasy television film ''[[Descendants (2015 film)|Descendants]]''. In 2015, Jobrani released a memoir entitled ''I'm Not a Terrorist, But I've Played One On TV''.{{cite news|last1=Mechanic|first1=Michael|title=Bombs Sometimes, Kills Often, But Maz Jobrani Swears He Isn't a Terrorist|url=https://www.motherjones.com/media/2014/11/interview-maz-jobrani-iranian-comedian-not-terrorist-memoir|work=Mother Jones|date=February 3, 2015}} ===Standup style=== Jobrani's jokes focus on race and the misunderstanding of Middle Easterners in America. He also talks about his family. ===Philanthropy=== Jobrani sits on the board of the Persian American Cancer Institute ([http://www.paci.org/ PACI.org]) and also works with International Society for Children with Cancer ([http://iscc-charity.org/ ISCC-Charity.org]). ==Personal life== In 2006, Jobrani married an [[Indian-American]] attorney named Preetha. They have a son and daughter and reside in California. ==Stand up specials== *2007 ''[[Axis of Evil Comedy Tour|Axis of Evil Comedy Special]]'' *2009 ''Brown & Friendly'' *2013 ''I Come in Peace'' *2015 ''I'm Not a Terrorist, But I've Played One On TV'' *2017 ''Immigrant'' ==See also== * [[Iranian stand-up comedy]] * [[Axis of Evil Comedy Tour]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * {{Official website|http://www.mazjobrani.com/}} * {{IMDb name|id=0423414|name=Maz Jobrani}} * {{TED speaker}} * {{cite journal |first=Amar |last=Bakshi |year=2007 |title=Maz Jobrani and Jack Bauer in How the World Sees America |journal=Washington Post/Newsweek |url=http://newsweek.washingtonpost.com/postglobal/america/2007/08/jack_bauer.html |accessdate=8 January 2011}} * [http://www.bodazey.com/maz_jobrani.html Interview and photos] * [http://www.bodazey.com/Iranian_American_Entertainers_Speaking_Out.html Maz Jobrani speaks out about Democracy for Iranians] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20110216203627/http://www.sandiego.com/comedy/interview-with-comedian-maz-jobrani Interview with SanDiego.com, 2/14/2011] * [http://manschoolshow.com/blog/2013/12/18class-42-being-an-immigrant-with-maz-jobrani Maz Jobrani speaks about the immigrant experience for an Iranian-American] {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Jobrani, Maz}} [[Category:1972 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:American male actors]] [[Category:American male comedians]] [[Category:American people of Iranian descent]] [[Category:American stand-up comedians]] [[Category:Iranian emigrants to the United States]] [[Category:Iranian stand-up comedians]] [[Category:People from Tiburon, California]] [[Category:People from Tehran]] [[Category:University of California, Berkeley alumni]] [[Category:University of California, Los Angeles alumni]] [[Category:Comedians from California]]
